instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> come in mysterious no power issue, customer said no water no drop etc
i open it and have a quick look, it looks fine, look closer <CAPACITOR>C7371</CAPACITOR> exploded turned into a wire pushing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMP</SIGNAL> to ground
plugged in charger green brown light, started checking voltages, I start with <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>, this is 0.7 to 1V 
no point in checking any other voltages if s5 is fucked
any ideas?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Voltage at F7140?

This may be one of the rare instances that F7140 has blown. You need to start looking at the charging voltage before S5...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: dude, you just made me $450, thank you. ppvbat/ppbus fuse who would have known

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: voltage was 0.8 volts, ohms was fine but OL on diode mode, there was also a black dot on the top, so replaced it and tested now is working

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Ohms was fine but it was diode was O/L? those measurements dont add up..
Anyway, no problem :)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: yeah i know, I try not to think about it too much
